name: MORIA, paladin of Blibdoulpoulp (fighter 15 / paladin 3 / rogue 25)
author: Pan Draconis

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content:
Moria, paladin of Blibdoulpoulp
 
Moria means « madness » in old greek.
 


Sorry for my bad english, I’m french ;)
A long time ago, Moria, an elfic little minded and mad warrior has been found by the kuo-ta and should be used as a sacrifice to Blibdoulpoulp. But at the time, The child of bhaal slayed every kuo-ta in this place and Moria survived. To survive, Moria prayed the fish god of Darkness and Madness and infused his power. Blibdoulpoulp was seduced by the true madness of Moria. However, Moria has been and always is a good girl, a bit wood-headed, unable to catch the evilness of Blibdoulpoulp.
A good girl devoted to an evil mad fish god is, of course, pure nonsense, pure madness. Moria sacrifices evil guys, and only evil guys, to the Supreme Fish (not a mc donald burger). Moria is sneaky, almost invisible, she has to hide from his own god because Blibdoulpoulp doesn’t have to know that Moria do good things in thy name. In fact, Moria wants to keep the power of the Supreme Fish which allows her to (divine) burn backstab his ennemis with two sharpened fisherman knives.
Blibdoulpoulp is satsified by the sacrifices, but angry about the goodness of Moria. As a punshment,  thy curses Moria : she will be very very slow to learn new things.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
neludz wrote:
Feb 12, 2023
Why not go Rogue at 1 level to get more skillpoints?
Well, there are a few things there. First, yes, you get more skill points, but what would you put them in that would be useful rather than nice? Second, if you plan on playing from L1 up, it helps to boost early AB, and Rogue at L2 also boosts AC. Third, while I'd be doing some different things at different times, if, as stated, this is an RP build, who are we to argue?

Cheers

Unless playing in an absolutely unforgiving or / and low-xp environment, getting to level 2 isn't that hard with ranged weapons / traps / wands etc. You only need 1000 xp after all.
As for where to put skill points, i find this question a bit strange. Tightness on skills is in Moria's CONS. There are many options where these 24 points could go.
Ah, and this build is surely amazing in general, should have said this from the start.

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content: You're right about those 24 points, the truth is that I don't want this dude to be called "a rogue", so the choice of the fighter first level is very RP linked (+ a bit easier  to play). :)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you want to role-play her as some kind of mad warrior, then I can see why you don't want her to be called "rogue", even if she has 25 rogue levels. 
The alignment of this mad girl is conflicting and a wisdom of 8 is spot on if you ask me.
As for the difficulty of playing an elven rogue with dexterity 18 on level 1, I agree with neludz, that shouldn't be hard at all unless the mod is extremely unforgiving.
